title: How to Make Gluten‐Free Stuffing

steps.headline: Toast your bread.
steps.description: To start, you should toast your gluten-free bread, which you should cut into small cubes. Preheat your oven to 325 degrees Fahrenheit (about 162 degrees Celsius) and separate the cubes of bread between two large baking sheets. Toast the bread in the oven for about 30 minutes. When done, the bread will be golden brown. When they're done, transfer the bread to a large bowl and set aside.

steps.headline: Heat your olive oil.
steps.description: You should heat your olive oil over medium heat. When it's done heating, it should simmer slightly.

steps.headline: Cook your sausage.
steps.description: Cook your sausage in a large pot. Heat the sausage, stirring frequently, until there are no pink parts remaining. This should take around three minutes. When the sausage is done, remove it from the oil with a slotted spoon and then set it aside.

steps.headline: Add the vegetables and herbs.
steps.description: Start with the celery, cooking it until it just begins to soften. This should take around two minutes. Then, add the the onion and  cook for an additional two minutes and then add the garlic, herbs, salt, and pepper. Stir the herbs and vegetables until they give off a strong smell. Use a spoon to remove the vegetables and herbs and place them in the bowl with the breadcrumbs.

steps.headline: Combine the sausage with the bread mixture.
steps.description: Add the sausage pieces to the mixing bowl that contains the breadcrumbs, vegetables, and herbs. Mix everything together until you have a uniform mixture.

steps.headline: Add your broth one cup at a time.
steps.description: Start by adding one cup of broth to the bread. Stir for about a minute, until the bread absorbs the broth. Once the broth is absorbed, add a second cup. Again, stir for about a minute or until the broth is absorbed. If the bread crumbs still seem a little dry, you can add a third cup of broth. The bread crumbs should be a little moist, but not spongy.

steps.headline: Cook your stuffing.
steps.description: Place your stuffing in a greased 9 by 13 inch pan. Put the pan into the oven, which should still be set at 375 degrees Fahrenheit, and cover it with tinfoil. Cook your stuffing covered for 30 minutes. After 30 minutes, remove the foil. Cook the stuffing again until the top becomes golden brown. This should take about 5 more minutes.

methods.name: Making Stuffing with Lamb and Rice

steps.headline: Melt your butter.
steps.description: Measure out your butter. Toss it into a large sauce pan and turn the heat to medium. Allow the butter to melt.

steps.headline: Cook the onion.
steps.description: Add the chopped onions and cook until the onions are soft. This should take about four minutes. Stir the onions frequently as they cook.

steps.headline: Add the lamb and spices.
steps.description: Place the lamb in the same pan as the onions. You should also add the garlic, cinnamon, cardamon, and allspice. Cook your lamb, spices, and onions in the skillet until the lamb is no longer pink and any liquid from the butter has evaporated. This takes around four minutes.

steps.headline: Throw in the rice, chickpeas, and salt.
steps.description: In addition to adding the rice and chickpeas, throw in a pinch of salt. This will help bring out the taste of the spices. Cook everything together until all your ingredients are evenly coated in the spices.

steps.headline: Pour in the broth and water.
steps.description: After adding the stock and water, bring everything to a boil. Cover the pan and cook your mixture on low heat for 20 minutes. After 20 minutes have passed, remove the mixture from the stove and set aside for 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Cook the pine nuts.
steps.description: Heat your oil in a skillet until it's shimmering. Add the pine nuts and cook them over medium heat. Stir them constantly to prevent them from burning or sticking to the pan. This should take about four minutes.

steps.headline: Combine your rice mixture and pine nuts.
steps.description: Transfer the mixture of rice, meat, and other ingredients to a bowl. Add your pine nuts and mix everything together. Your stuffing is now ready to serve.

steps.headline: Combine the bread crumbs with water.
steps.description: Place the bread in a 9 by 13 inch baking pan. Then, add your broth and water a little at a time. Stop adding broth and water when the bread is soft without being soggy.

steps.headline: Mix in the  eggs, mushrooms, onions, celery, herbs, olive oil and salt and pepper.
steps.description: Transfer these ingredients to the baking pan with your bread. It's easiest to mix this together with your hands. Wash, rinse, and dry your hands with soap and water. Use your hands to work the mixture together into an even, uniform texture that is somewhat thick.

steps.headline: Bake your stuffing.
steps.description: Transfer the baking pan to an oven preheated to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (about 175 degrees Celsius). Cook for about 45 minutes. You can tell it's done when the top is browned slightly.
